alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Karnes; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern DeWitt, central Karnes and central Wilson Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 707 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sutherland Springs to near Kosciusko to near Yorktown. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Floresville, Karnes City, Poth, Yorktown, Kosciusko, Runge, Falls City, Nordheim, Gillett, Cestohowa, Sutherland Springs, Cotton Patch, Gruenau, New Davy, Paweleville, Hobson, Ecleto, Helena and Pana Maria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
